text:
Here is a fun question that I was wondering about. There is the eternal debate on StackOverflow and Programmers on whether people prefer a simple if statement with braces or not.

*Exhibit 1:*

```
if(condition) {
    statement;
}
```

*Exhibit 2:*

`if(condition) statement;`

Here is the kicker. For some reason I've only seen one person suggesting this style

*Exhibit 3:*

`if(condition) { statement; }`

Imo this is the best of both worlds (readability + error safety + branch merge safety). Which one do you prefer?
me as well. I just find it so weird that I've only seen one person talk about 3 even though if you think about it IntelliJ does 3 automatically with collapsing
we only use the second one in case it’s a return statement
otherwise we try to use number 1

i’d rather have something like this

```
if(somethingThatShouldNotHappen) { return; }

… lots of code ...
```

than 

```
if(!somethingThatShouldNotHappen) { 
  … lots of code …
 }
return 
```
the only difference in our company is that for the return we don’t use the braces :smile:
I prefer guard ifs as well
everything on the top, get it out of the way and do the rest of the logic
The only "bad" thing about #3 is that you have to configure the IDE (which is literally one checkbox) and Checkstyle (which is like 30 seconds)
that’s the problem with straying from defaults I guess
I could see this as a minor issue for OS projects. But within companies having a _settings_ repository and a codestyle document is a must
I am just in the process of rewriting said document that is why I came on this question
<@U09T8SFG8>: that is a power that no single man should be entrusted with
don't get me wrong, I want to get a template down with common stuff and then work with the new recruits to finalize it
MATE YOU DON'T TELL ME WHAT TO DO
Generally I try to keep to a loose interpretation of Equinox style
it generally works well for me
for my projects I do a mix of Sun and Google style

attachments.title: Equinox Coding Practices
attachments.text: Eclipse is probably best known as a Java IDE, but it is more: it is an IDE framework, a tools framework, an open source project, a community, an eco-system, and a foundation.

text: I think I have told you before that I get triggered when I see the word Eclipse
But I like this, seems quite simple
some good stuff comes out of those guys
`if(condition) ? statement : {//a shit ton of code here in one line};`
wide screen retina displays have too much empty space on the end of the line
with java I tend to keep the `if(condition) statement` to a minimum, mostly using them for inline null checks
i still like using guard ifs
In general for me if something fits in one line and does not look too busy, then I put it in one line since I am so used to IntelliJ/AS already doing that
like a before statement in junit
`@Before public void beforeEach() { gsonJsonSerializer = new GsonJsonSerializer(gson); }`
it won't really look nice in slack
but in code it looks ok
well having everything nullable isn’t really the kotlin way imo
it’s a rare example where you need more than 2 nullables
my code looks like a bad exam paper
I’d call that a burek but ok
that's a LIDL pita right there
Croatians are taking over this slack group
it’s a burek if it’s with meat, otherwise it’s a pita :smirk:
well, burek is a kind of pita
hah for me it’s a bit different - pita = sweet with filling on top, strudl = sweet with filling in a wrap, burek = savoury with filling in a wrap
oh but saying a pita with cheese is a burek is like insulting the whole bosnia at once
burek is pita filled with meat
<@U053PPGDC>: yep, I said “burek with cheese” once and got trashed because of it. saw it happen to many people.
Kind of sensitive don´t you think?
our fast food places were always - mesni burek, sirni burek, mesni burek 2000, pizza burek
<@U19DK3ZQ9>:  burek is not just a food, it’s kind of a religion here

> yep, I said “burek with cheese” once and got trashed because of it
:joy:
it’s one of those pan-style bureks
it’s got a fried egg and mileram inside
perfect I’m so drunk I can barely stand food
sounds like the perfect saviour of drunk people
I’m going home next week and this is on the itinerary
if you find yourself in velenje def grab it
I tried pizza burek in ljubljana a few times, still not sure if it’s awesome or bad
